thread.title: Binghamton guard Yacob's season in doubt
thread.title_full: Binghamton guard Yacob's season in doubt

title: Binghamton guard Yacob's season in doubt
text:
Activate your digital access. Binghamton guard Yacob's season in doubt 
Binghamton University sophomore guard Yosef Yacob throws a pass during a November game against Hartwick College in the Events Center. Yacob was an America East Conference All-Rookie selection last season. (Photo: Kristopher Radder / Staff photo) BU Bearcats Lynn Worthy, lworthy@pressconnects.com | @PSBLynn 7:48 p.m. EDT October 7, 2015 
Binghamton University junior guard Yosef Yacob could miss the entire season due to a shoulder injury that limited his activity this summer. 
Yacob, a 6-foot, 175-pound point guard from Chester, Pa., has been dealing with a torn labrum and is scheduled to get an MRI this week, according to men's basketball coach Tommy Dempsey. Depending on the outcome of the MRI, Yacob could be prescribed either a regiment of rest and rehab or surgery. Even if he avoids surgery, Yacob could have to sit out a month. If he has surgery, Yacob may miss the entire 2015-16 season. Worthy: Dusan Perovic's return gives BU men optimism 
Yacob earned America East Conference All-Rookie honors in 2013-14. He averaged 11.5 points per game, and finished the season as the team's second-leading scorer. He ranked second on the team in assists (70) and third in steals (26). 
Last season, Yacob suffered a shooting slump (34 percent overall) and saw his playing time cut into by freshmen guards Romello Walker and Justin McFadden. Yacob started 15 games and average 5.8 points per game as a sophomore. Marlon Beck, Dusan Perovic, Justin McFadden and coach Tommy Demspey share their thoughts heading into this season of Binghamton U. men's basketball. Lynn Worthy Read or Share this story: http://press.sn/1RuqW4i Most Popular
